title.narrative: Improvement of WASH services for communities most affected by hurricanes Eta and Iota, including psychosocial support, child protection and violence prevention

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide water, sanitation, hygiene and child protection services to hurricane-affected people. This UNICEF project provides clean, disinfect and rehabilitate wells, install handwashing stations, promote hygiene and establish Child Friendly and Safe Spaces among other activities. The project provides life-saving assistance to approximately 10,000 people, including 2,700 women, 2,700 men, 5,000 children, and 1,000 people with disabilities.

description.narrative: Child Protection: Prevention and mitigation measures are guaranteed to face the different episodes of violence against children and adolescents, including victims of violence and GBV survivors, through strengthening of prevention commissions in neighbourhoods and communities, and timely, quality, multisectoral response services with case management.
# girls, boys, adolescents’ access specialized protective services, including GBV, through referrals and case management

# girls, boys, parents and primary caregivers in humanitarian situations provided mental health and psychosocial support and child protective services, including access to child friendly safe spaces with intersectoral programming interventions
# women, girls and boys benefiting from CP and GBV risk mitigation and prevention interventions.

Hygiene promotion: At-risk and affected populations have timely access to culturally appropriate, gender- and age-sensitive information, services and interventions related to hygiene promotion and handwashing for prevention of COVID-19 and water-borne diseases; the population adopt safe hygiene practices, by provision of key hygiene items (hygiene kits including gender-focused items) and hygiene promotion by trained volunteers and institutional staff.
# people reached with critical WASH supplies (including hygiene items) and services
# people reached with hand-washing behaviour-change programmes

Sanitation: Affected populations have safe access to and use appropriate and gender-segregated sanitation facilities, by provision of key sanitation humanitarian supplies and services to support their needs, minimizing their exposure and safeguarding them from excreta contamination, vector and water-borne diseases.
# people accessing appropriately designed and managed latrines

Water: Affected populations have safe and equitable access to, and use a sufficient quantity and quality of drinking water to meet their drinking and domestic needs, by provision of key water humanitarian supplies and services to support their needs, enabling them to practice healthy hygiene habits, which in turn reinforcing prevention of COVID-19 spread, in the affected communities.
# people accessing a sufficient quantity of safe water for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene
